q: How to Fix Sql Error? Cannot open database requested by the login.
answer: If you encounter the error message SQL Error you will need to perform the following actions:
First open your SQL Server to check if your database is (Single User)
Go to services and restart SQL Server service.

Next open your SQL Server and create New Query on this Database and Execute the following Query:
ALTER DATABASE [YourDatabase] SET MULTI_USER
notes: Don't forget to change [YourDatabase] to your current database name.

q: What steps can be taken to prevent the system from selling when the quantity is zero or negative?
answer:
In order to do this you have to tick Check aval. Qty in cash sale and Untick Allow Passing Unavailable Qty in 3 places (Preference, Type and Warehouse).
First go to System > Preference > Select Operartions Tab > Stock > tick Check aval. Qty in cash sale > Untick Allow Passing Unavailable Qty.
Next go to Data Entry > Types > Operations Type > Data Entry Tab Untick Allow Passing Unavailable Qty.
Next go to Data Entry > Item > Warehouse > Data Entry Tab Untick Allow Passing Unavailable Qty.
Please ensure that the Lite POS option is unchecked in the system's Preferences under the POS tab.

q: How to export / import Journal Voucher (JV)?
answer:
Navigate to System > Synchronize > Export and search for the JV number you wish to export in the Number field. i.e: JV000014.
At the top right under Timer enter company name followed by year with a space in between i.e: ab 23.
Tick Accounting and Export.
Now navigate to system > Synchronize > import > Select the Browse button and enter the file path for the exported JV, then click on the Import button.
notes: By adding a comma between each number, it is possible to import/export multiple JVs simultaneously.

q: How to find duplicate descriptions across multiple item codes, combining their quantities, and eliminating any unnecessary codes?
answer:
You can use the following query:
SELECT description, COUNT(*) as count FROM sfitem GROUP BY description HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

Go to Operations > System Maintenance > Change item code.
Input the item that you want to remove in the From field and the item that you want to keep in the To field. Than Press Save
This operation will merge qty and will delete unnecessary item.
If the item has an initial quantity, it will not be deleted, but rather marked as inactive, thereby fulfilling the condition for its non-deletion.
notes: This query will group the items in the table by their descriptions and count how many items share the same description. It will then filter the results to only show descriptions that appear more than once (i.e., duplicates). The output will include the description and the count of how many times it appears in the table.

q: What is the process for updating the invoice rate from 1,515 to a new rate?
answer:
First do backup: go to End of session > backup.
You can use the following query to select:
select * from sftran inner join curtra on sftran.date=curtra.date and sftran.currcode=curtra.currcode where typecode='CA' and opercode='60' and month(sftran.date) >= 2 and year(sftran.date) = 2023

Than use the following query to update:
update sftran set ratelc=curtra.ratelc, ratebc=curtra.ratebc from sftran inner join curtra on sftran.date=curtra.date and sftran.currcode=curtra.currcode where typecode='CA' and opercode='60' and month(sftran.date) >= 2 and year(sftran.date) = 2023
Navigate to the invoice and click on Refresh to verify that the updated rates are functional.

Proceed to Operations > System Maintenance > Fix and select Vouchers. Input the starting date for the fix (in this case, 01/02/2023) in the From field and specify a type in the Operation Type field (e.g., CA). Finally, click on Save.
Than go operations > accounting > system maintenance > fix > select Yes.

Than run this query to update the tottvalc column in the sftran table
update sftran set tottvalc = cast (ratelc * tottva as decimal(18,2)) where currcode <> '01'
notes: This SQL query updates the ratelc and ratebc columns in the sftran table with the corresponding values from the curtra table, based on certain conditions using an inner join. The update is performed only on rows where typecode is 'CA', date is in or after February 2023.

q: What is the process for conducting inventory?
answer:
Go to Operations > Periodic Operation > Inventory.
Please input any numerical value in the designated number field.
Select the Warehouse for which you wish to conduct inventory.
Tick All Items.

Upon clicking the preview button, you will initially see all items listed in the window with a default quantity of zero. To update the actual quantity of items available in the specified warehouse, you may either add a new row by pressing Add Row button and input the new quantity or use the Get template button to open an Excel file and enter the updated quantities there.

Once you have entered the updated quantities, you will need to check the update movement checkbox and select an operation type in the designated field. Finally, you can save the changes by clicking the save button.
You can now navigate to Operations > movement section to view the updates you have made to the quantity.
notes: One way to verify the quantity of your item is by navigating to the item section within data entry and selecting the quantity tab.

answer: Go to Operation Type > Account No. Tab > Tick Account Vat And Non Vat and Account No Vat Rate checkbox.
To apply the new settings, simply click on modify to the invoice and then save.
Proceed to the reports section, then select statement of accounts to view the VAT amount separately displayed in Lebanese Pound (LBP) and US Dollar ($) on the statements report.

q: How to Fix Printer Spooler Errors in Windows?
answer: If you come across the Printer Spooler Problem error message, you can resolve it by restarting the print spooler using the following steps:
Either press the Windows key on your keyboard or click/tap inside the Search box and type the word services. Then, press Enter when you see the Services search result, or click or tap on it.
Go down the list of services arranged alphabetically and select Print Spooler. Click Restart.
notes: The Print Spooler is responsible for common printing errors on Windows by organizing data and sending it to low memory peripheral devices such as printers. When the Print Spooler fails, print jobs can get stuck in the queue, and the print data won't reach the printer. Resetting the spooler can solve these problems, canceling the print job and allowing a fresh start.

q: How to fix this small difference in trial balance?
answer: In the event of a minor discrepancy in the trial balance, the following steps should be taken:
To address the small difference in the trial balance, access the opening journal voucher, select the Modify option, press the F5 key on your keyboard, and then Save the changes.
Now, proceed to verify the trial balance, ensuring that the discrepancy has been resolved.
notes: If you come across a small discrepancy in the trial balance after calculating the difference of exchange, only then should you proceed with the aforementioned steps. However, if you encounter a significant difference, it would be advisable to instead initiate the process of calculating the profit and loss.

q: How can I resolve the issue of charges code not being displayed in purchases?
answer: To resolve the issue of a charges code not appearing in purchases, you can take the following steps:
Navigate to the data entry section > Accounting > charges. Select the charges code that is missing and click on modify Make sure to check the box for Purchases and then save the changes.
After completing the aforementioned steps, the charges code should now be visible in the purchases section.
notes: The same steps can be followed for Sales and Production as well.
